content.description: Fun sport route with varied face and hueco climbing. There is a short approach ramp (50 feet, 3 bolts) that doesn't really count as a pitch. The first true pitch is a good warm up at 5.11-. The second pitch is the crux and is a test of technical edge skills. The third pitch wanders up and left to a thin section above an overlap (5.11). The last pitch is not to be missed. Easy 5.10 huecos and edges take you up a twisted arete 350' above the canyon.
content.location: Most of the belays are semi-hanging. Rap the route. One 60m rope is all you need.

content.description:
A nice dark patina face riddled with positive flakes and four drilled pockets. Equipped with three pitons and a solid anchor. Bring a long stick-clip for the first piton.

Cruxes are off the deck and again at the upper blank patina panel (two drilled pockets make it possible). Committing moves to the chains keep the climbing exhilarating.  Though short and sweet, could be considered a classic Snow Canyon vertical face route.
content.location: The Fray is the last route at 'The War Zone' and located to the right of 'Black Massacre' on the dark patina face.

content.description: Hard start then sustained vertical climbing past 6 pins.  Some drilled finger pockets detract from the overall quality of the route, but it's still fun.
content.location: 100 yards south of Richness of It All, right off the trail.  Next to Black Massacre.

content.description:
This route has drilled pockets, but could be climbed at 11d without them.  P1/2 can be linked and you can lower with a 70M rope.

P1: 6 pins through drilled pocket start (5.11b)

P2: Continue up through reachy move past 6-7 pins (5.10c+)

P3: Follow 9 pins left and then back right.
content.location: Middle route in the group of three to the left of Richness
